intro: Paronychia sclerocephala, commonly known as the hard-headed paronychia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Paronychia sclerocephala is adapted to arid conditions and has a relatively long lifespan, often surviving for several years.
